New Records: Mabululu converted a rebound after his penalty hit the bar, marking a significant moment in the match.
Key Match Events: Mabululu scored an equalizer in the 65th minute after his penalty was saved.
Baghdad Bounedjah gave Algeria an early lead with a clinical finish after 18 minutes.
Bounedjah's second goal was disallowed due to an offside ruling after a VAR review.
Pre-Game Insights: Algeria entered the match as favorites but struggled to maintain control.
Angola came into the game on the back of four consecutive goalless draws.
Post-Match Reflections: Algeria faced frustration similar to their 2022 performance as defending champions who crashed out in the group stages.
Angola displayed resilience, holding on for a draw despite being the lower-ranked team.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was in Group D of the Africa Cup of Nations.
Riyad Mahrez was a constant threat at set-plays for Algeria.
